meanings.definition: To turn or pivot on a swivel.
meanings.sent1: She swivelled her chair to face the window.
meanings.sent2: He swivelled the spotlight to illuminate the stage.
meanings.sent3: The owl swivelled its head to keep an eye on the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse swivelled its beam across the dark sea.
meanings.sent5: The dancer swivelled gracefully on one foot.

meanings.definition: To rotate or twist on a central point.
meanings.sent1: The windmill swivelled in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: He swivelled the knob to adjust the temperature.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat swivelled its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The compass needle swivelled wildly in the magnetic storm.
meanings.sent5: The clock hand swivelled slowly around the face.

meanings.sent1: The car swivelled around the corner effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: She swivelled her hips to the beat of the music.
meanings.sent3: The robot swivelled its sensors to scan the room.
meanings.sent4: The weather vane swivelled to indicate the wind direction.
meanings.sent5: The basketball player swivelled to avoid the defender.
